attributes.action: act on his party's promise in their winning manifesto to take a referendum of the British people on the European Treaty/Constitution.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Since the Treaties of Rome in 1958,and the Treaty of Maastricht in 1993.We,the British people have only had one chance,in 1975,to declare our interest in wether we wish to remain part of but not run by Europe.In 1975 in the U.K. referendum over 67% of citizens voted "Yes",we were badly informed of the consquences of this vote.The present government promised in their manifesto that we would have a vote on the new treaty/constitution.They have not,and I don't believe will,keep that promise.We,in this great Country,deserve better.Our new citizens,mainly coming from the E.U. also have a right to vote on their future.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
